My Blog

Mobile Development: What I learned so far

Introduction

My journey into mobile development began when I started to wonder how mobile apps are created. There's millions of mobile apps these days and they have transformed how we live. I was always curious as to how mobile apps were created, it baffled me how much thought that went into creating an app, and the amount of code it took to make it functional.

Luckily, in my 3rd year of school, we took on a mobile development class which again, sparked my interest in mobile development. I like being creative with my work and mobile development allows me to be as creative as possible.

Platforms, Tools and Languages I'm Learning

In class we have been focusing on two main platforms, Android Studio and Flutter. Android Studio is more for building Android Apps while Flutter allows us to build cross-platform apps.

Also, we use Java, and Dart as the coding languages to build our apps. I found that both Java and Dart are very similar, but Dart is less strict with its typing. Its been really interesting so far.

A Small Project I've Done So Far

As part of class assignments, a project I've done so far was a calculator app that I built on Android Studio using Java. It does basic calculations with user input, like division, addition, multiplication, and subtraction. I've also added an assistive feature on it which is text-to-speech.

Creating the app was fun and I learned a lot.

Goals in Mobile Development

I hope that one day, I would be able to create creative, fun, and meaningful applications for users. I want to learn more and do more projects when I have the time and to hopefully make a good impact with my work.
